website_summaries.verdict: A memory foam bamboo camping pillow for those who want to backpack in luxury.
pros: Pillow is compressible for lightweight travel
Includes a cooling cover made from bamboo and a blend of other materials
cons: Takes up more space in backpack than other similar models

website_summaries.verdict: A memory foam pillow that comes with a stuff sack and a 100-day trial period.
pros: Expands after compression to twice its size
Includes the option to customize your firmness by taking out some of the stuffing
cons: This pillow weighs a little more than other camping pillow options and doesn't compress as small

customer_reviews.title: Requires Sacrifices for the Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a comfortable pillow for camping, and I got one. The problem is that I'm not very good at figuring out measurements. I prefer to eyeball things, and sometimes that's difficult to do online. This pillow takes up a good amount of space in my 40L backpack. It's hard to stuff into its case, and it definitely has that strange memory foam smell. It's extremely comfortable, but the comfort comes with a price. I'd say this pillow is more for people who don't have a limited amount of baggage/space for their trips.
customer_reviews.author: coraebeth

customer_reviews.title: Poor pillow if you want to travel light
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is super dense and super heavy. I had to remove half of the stuffing for it to be light enough to travel with. It’s probably fine if you travel heavy but I definitely thought it would be more compressible. This takes up almost as much space as my normal pillow. The quality is fine but if you were planning on stuffing this in the top of your pack or suitcase you’ll need to budget way more space than the average travel pillow.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have a twin sized bed in my camper van that I share with my S.O. I wanted high quality pillows that didn't take up too much space. These pillows pack up small and blow up to a very comfortable size while having a very adequate balance between firm and fluff. Our pillows are still pretty new, but they seem to be well built and durable. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Zaskoda

customer_reviews.title: Best Camping/Travel Pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This little pillow is super soft and plush, Looks and feels of high quality, comes with a pillow case and stuff bag( like a sleeping bag) Cons: a bit heavy, has a chemical smell.. hoping it goes away once I use it more, a bit hard to put into stuff bag but not too bad (when you receive the pillow it’s sealed air tight and expands to a pretty nice size) stuff bag won’t last, it’s not very good quality. Seams are already coming apart. All in all a nice camping and travel pillow unless you plan on backpacking, it’s too heavy to carry for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Intolerable Chemical Odor
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this. Great size, super comfortable, but a HORRIBLE chemical smell. Despite airing the pillow out for a day, the odor filled the room. Absolutely no way I could sleep on this. Think twice about buying this if you are prone to migraines or are sensitive to chemical odor. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Pillow arrived, but not promised stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: "Includes Stuff Sack Great for Backpacking, Airplane or car Travel ". Except, it doesn't. Only the pillow in shrink-wrapped single-use plastic. Vendors on Amazon are getting very good at advertising one thing and delivering another...
customer_reviews.author: Judith Morton

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable pillow I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I own the standard size of this same pillow and it is the most comfortable pillow I have ever owned due to a number of factors. The removable bamboo cover is soft and cooling, and the shredded memory foam is very soft, plus you can remove or add foam depending on how much foam you desire to have in the pillow and how firm or soft you prefer it to be. This travel pillow was designed the same way. I just received it and it feels as nice as the standard one I have. I've yet to adjust the contents to my preferred level but I am confident of the same results.
customer_reviews.author: Tom J

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the regular size
customer_reviews.text: My regular size pillow is fantastic and that's why I wanted the travel size for our train trip. Sadly, they didn't do as well as I had hoped and lost their support pretty fast. However,to be fair, I am super hard on pillows which is why I ordered the regular size many months ago, which I love. I can refill it with the stuffing sent with the pillow. I wish the travel size was as good as my big one, but they soon goo hard quickly and need constant fluffing. 😒☹️
customer_reviews.author: Kathy in Texas

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a shameful stomach sleeper. I know, wrinkles and neck pain. But, I love it. Hotel and friend pillows suck. This had about twice or maybe even 3x the filling I wanted, so it's all in a bag for who knows what later. But, it's easy to stuff and just so so so soft. I actually bought a smaller stuff sack eventually to compress it down even more. I can get it into a 2L, but it's hard. Love this pillow and recommend it to all!
customer_reviews.author: Laura B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but slightly bulky with odd smell
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers mentioned, this is probably not a great back-packing pillow. It is bulky and takes up a lot of space in your bag. There is also an odd foam smell that 2 weeks of use + repeated dryer running (as the instructions recommend) has not removed. Other than these two issues, I am quite pleased with the pillow. It is fluffy and comfortable on the head. The bag opens up, so owners can remove fluff if needed to adjust size of pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Don't use in cool weather. Pillow is hard at 50 degrees, or below!
customer_reviews.text: Note on pillow says pillow is hard at 50 degrees. Wanted to use pillow for hut-to-hut rustic hiking in Switzerland in October. I'm pretty sure it's going to be blow 50 degrees!
customer_reviews.author: Watters in Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Great for traveling but not great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I have the full size pillow on my bed so I bought this for a trip to Australia because you never know what kind of pillows you’ll end up with in hotels or AirB&Bs. It’s super comfy and I slept great on my trip. I only gave 4 stars because it is NOT easy to roll up and get back in the travel pouch, and it’s quite big for airplane use so it’s not a “travel pillow” that you’d really be able to use on a plane. It’s a great pillow to use once you’re at your destination or for camping & stuff, but not great for the actual travel days on trains, planes, & automobiles.
customer_reviews.author: A. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and fluffy
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is very comfortable after it plumps back up, which typically takes about 45-60 minutes. The feel is medium-firm. The cover is comfortable but I would suggest purchasing pillow cases for ease of washing. My husband has pinched nerves in his neck and this pillow has been a lifesaver when he travels for work. There is an odor when you first receive the pillow, which dissipates if you put it in the drier for an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Redliana

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for travel. Now, I just use it everywhere, even at home.
customer_reviews.text: Like my headline says, I bought this pillow for travel. It rolls up, fits in the included travel bag just fine; so, it does not take up too much room in my suitcase. I did not expect the pillow to feel 'just right' -- I like it so much I just use the pillow when I am at home, too. Question: Why do I have "a kid's pillow on my bed? A: Who cares. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Camping pillow delight
customer_reviews.text: Camping pillows are expensive all around, but most are focused on portability and not comfort. While this pillow compromised space it is very comfortable and well worth the extra space it takes up. The bag it comes with helps compress the pillow to about half its size. I actually took this on a 15 day rafting trip and while its doesnt compare to my big size everyday pillow, its hands down better than any camping pillow I've ever tried. Tip: Make sure to buy a pillow case, I found that pillow cases for infants work well with this pillow
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: these are the best I have used for travel and camping
customer_reviews.text: I remove some of the inner material for adjustment and my personal comfort level. Stuff sack is a great idea also. I used to just use my back pack as a pillow but now I'm older with neck and back issues. Other pillows for camping are not comfortable. Plain and simple. Zippers on these pillows could be bigger and tougher because I wash mine regularly. However I also got the cover to protect it so that I do not have to wash the actual pillow as frequently. Hands down, these are the best for my camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis

customer_reviews.title: I travel all the time and love the comfort and compactness of this pillow!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like all features of this pillow! I will note what I did to first wash the pillow. I washed it like advised but I could not get it dried completely. I laid a dry towel on a bed and removed all of the inside shredded memory foam. When the next morning, it was not completely dried, I put part of the foam in the case it came in and the rest in a finely woven lingerie bag and dried it on high heat. The smell was gone and I was able to add the amount I wanted with extra left over which I'm saving in case I want to add more. I have no complaints at all!
customer_reviews.author: DotA

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Adjustable Firmness
customer_reviews.text: I got this pillow for living in a tent for a month and didn’t want to sacrifice my neck. This pillow came packed super tightly with shredded memory foam. You can remove as much as you want to make the pillow the desired firmness which is great. I loved this pillow and I’ll definitely take it with me traveling or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect substitute for my tempur-pedic pillow while traveling for a month!
customer_reviews.text: I have slept with a tempur-pedic pillow for 20+ years. I’m not a good sleeper and was worried about traveling for an entire month and not being able to sleep well. I bought this foam travel pillow and one other and this one worked perfectly!! I’m so thrilled with it and didn’t miss my old pillow while traveling. I’m sensitive to chemical smells so I followed the advice of other reviewers and put it in the dryer with just air for a few minutes, plus gave it a few days to really air out.
customer_reviews.author: Mandee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is a 'neck saver' when traveling! My neck is very fussy with pillows, and this can be adjusted to your liking! I took it on a 2 week trip to Italy and Greece, and used it every night... NO sore neck because of pillows that I wasn't use to!! That gives it a 10 star for me!! It is small, but it flattens nice and fits in a carryon easily, then fluffs up quickly! So, I would rather have a smaller pillow to sleep on then a sore neck from junk pillows, that ruins a vacation!!
customer_reviews.author: loheresvi

customer_reviews.title: Travel perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect pillow for traveling. I took mine on a 12 hour flight and it works perfect for the window seat. I also ended up using it in the hotels and airbnbs. It’s the next best thing to having a full size pillow. The stuffing is adjustable if you like your pillow to be smaller or flatter. I personally like big plush firmer pillows and this came just the way I like it. It didn’t have any funky smells like some reviewers stated. I bought a silk pillowcase that zips up for mine so it wouldn’t absorb all the oil and dry my hair out.
customer_reviews.author: Talyr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, small pillow.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my long flight this summer. Make sure that you secure the zipper closed with a safety pin prior to washing. I forgot to do this and all of the stuffing came out in the washing machine. It was easy to put all of it back in the pillow, so everything ended up ok. It does have a smell as many reported but washing the pillow removes the smell. I have been using the pillow for short naps and it is very comfortable. I will update my review after my flight to report on its comfort.
customer_reviews.author: BebeLeBozo

customer_reviews.title: Sweet, sweet dreams!
customer_reviews.text: Hubby treated me to a queen sized pillow to help me manage my shoulder and neck pain. It worked miracles, I sleep soundly, comfortably and wake up feeling rested- not sore. I got the travel pillow to tuck under my arm as I am a side sleeper and to take on trips. An incredible buy for an incredible product!
customer_reviews.author: J. Starr

customer_reviews.title: The first night it was a little tight and puffy but the second night was better because it loosened up and was even more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pillow was shipped and arrived earlier than expected. I aired out the pillow and washed the cover because of a strong chemical odor. The next day I left on a hammock camping trip and used the Coop travel pillow for 2 nights. The first night it was a little tight and puffy but the second night was better because it loosened up and was even more comfortable. It's a little heavy for lightweight backpacking but worth the extra pounds for the comfort and definitely ideal for car camping. I do recommend this product over any travel pillow I've used so far.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but awful chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is great for comfort. However it has a terrible and unpleasant chemical smell. I know this will go away with time, but wow the fumes are awful! The straps on the bag were also installed backward. I know this is a bit nit-picky, but I ordered 3 and all of them were like this.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is incredibly comfortable and packs up pretty small for it's actually size. My daughter's have actually decided this is their pillow for traveling or camping. I may need to get a second one to keep them from fighting over it. A couple of minor issues are that it does have a strong scent at first that takes some time to go away. I even washed it and used fabric softener in the dryer and it still has a strong odor bit nothing that would deter me from sleeping on it. Also, the pillow does get hard in cold weather but as it warms up it's incredibly soft yet provides great support.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow for travel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow for travel to use in place of inconsistent, and usually just plain terrible, hotel pillows. I read the reviews saying it was too small to use for a primary pillow but purchased anyway. I was not disappointed. Yes, the pillow is small, but it’s fits perfectly into a 20” roller bag. I slept on it for 4 nights on a business trip and slept like a baby. I found it to have plenty of “stuffing”, not too stiff or tall that it stretched my neck, and not too soft of r “squishy” like down pillows. In short, I found it to be just right.
customer_reviews.author: M. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is super comfortable. I bought it for camping/backpacking. The only downside is that it's pretty big and heavy. You can use the included bag to compress it down pretty small. However, I wish the bag had a second strap like an actual compression bag. I purchased a 6L compression bag and unfortunately it was still bigger (the compression bag I bought only goes down to 9" long) than compressing it using the included bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Home away from home
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this pillow. I needed something for my deployment that packed easily but allowed me to feel more at home in my temporary new living arrangement. It makes being deployed away from my own bed that much easier. Thank you for giving me a home away from home.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra Manthe

customer_reviews.title: Not small - almost regular size
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality. Main downside is that it's not much smaller than a regular sized pillow. I wanted to use it for camping/traveling, so what I did is open up the seam, pull out half the stuffing, and sew it shut again (about 3/5 of the original size). Now it can realistically be used for travel. There's no way for the original size to fit in the stuff sack or be small enough to realistically save you much space for travel. But! Now that I've modified the size, I'm super excited about it.
customer_reviews.author: artsyfartsy

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfy camping pillow!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy! Filled with little cubes of some type of memory foam. Needs to be carried alone in its bag. I tried to roll it into the sleeping bag but it’s a little too thick for that. You can buy a toddler sized pillow case for it but I had to use a twin pillow case and just tied off the side with a hair scrunchy. I washed (and dried in the drier) both the pillow and the outer sleeve before use. No chemical smell. Glad I purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish Snugglepedic had comparable item, but COOP is great!
customer_reviews.text: My normal bed pillows are all Snugglepedic, however when looking for a nice memory foam camping pillow I stumbled upon COOP home goods. The size of the pillow unpacked is really a toddler pillow size, which makes it easy to find pillowcases (well, if you like superheroes :) and it is very supportive. This has a nifty stuff sack that allows you to compress it for storage in a tote or sleeping bag. I bought 2 (extra for another person or between legs) and really can't find a single problem with the item. I guess my only one is I do prefer the texture of the Snugglepedic removable cover to the diamond pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Eich

customer_reviews.title: Perfect traveling Pillow!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a brilliant pillow to begin with, but it also comes with it's own compression travel bag. The travel size worked great in the compression bag on the plan to help in the tight side spots. Then, fluffed out in a few minutes once i reached my destination. Now, I have the perfect pillow support and don't have to worry about my allergies while traveling. *I am allergic to the down feathers.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Buy this pillow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is seriously one of the best purchases I've made. Considering we sleep about quarter of our lives having a comfortable pillow is so important. This is the best pillow I've ever had in my life I'm 70 years old. I encourage everyone to buy this. This is not just for camping but for home use also.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little pillow
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pillow to take with me on a retreat and also to travel on the airplane. Followed all the directions from the manufacturer and put it in the dryer on low after I received it. The odor is gone after tumbling dry. It is such a cute pillow and I have tried it out before I take it with me. Very comfortable and functional. It is smaller than a standard size pillow, but larger than a travel pillow. The fact that it is made in the USA makes it even more desirable. The manufacturer sends follow up emails to make sure that I am a satisfied customer. Rest assured (no pun intended).....I am totally satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gs

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camping pillow - better than ones twice the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a plate in her neck and has a very difficult time finding a pillow. We were going on a three week camping trip and didn’t want to bring her big expensive pillow from home. After trying multiple high end camping pillows from here and REI we found this. Absolutely perfect. So comfortable for her neck and I bought one for myself too. Could not recommend more!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Zipper not functional after a handful of washes
customer_reviews.text: I use the pillow every night since I’m a stomach sleeper and I like something small and firm. I’ve had this pillow for 2 years now and it’s been about a year since the zipper on the cover worked. I appreciate being able to take it off to wash it, but after so many washes the zipper stopped moving. Now the cover is always half off overnight. Looking into something else since this isn’t going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It is nice pillow but too heavy
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pillow to take on the plane to Europe since it is a long flight. Every inch and every oz. is limited.I sent this pillow back because even before I opened all up I could tell it was too heavy. If I am going to carry it around it needs to be light and functionable
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Moen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pillow. I bought it for camping with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pillow. I bought it for camping with my son and his Boy Scout troop, and it hasn't disappointed. It scrunches up so compactly, but then fluffs up to be so perfect. i sleep with two pillows in bed, and so I've had to supplement my previous camp pillow with clothes or whatever else I could just to get the right height to sleep decently. Not necessary with this guy. It's soft and thick and very comfortable. I really am pleased with it, and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SFinNJ

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell doesn't go away.
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive little pillow with a fatal flaw -- the chemical stench which will not go away. Unfortunately I lost it in my travels, so cannot return. At least I got a stuff sack out of the deal. Unless your "industrial aesthetic sensibility" extends to toxic aromas, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: whaz

customer_reviews.title: New to me...
customer_reviews.text: Shredded memory foam was new to me. I anticipated a mess when adjusting the fill. Not so. I removed 1/2 the memory foam to meet my needs. No mess and extra foam stored easily in large ziplock bag. Zippered, padded pillow covers keep the shredded foam smooth. I'm a side/stomach sleeper. I use a small pillow between my knees for spinal balance. This item is a perfect fit. (That noted... the original weight prior to adjusting the fill, seemed way too heavy for backpacking.)
customer_reviews.author: mia coolpa

customer_reviews.title: Saved my neck!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pillow to take on work trips because I couldn't sleep with the puffy pillows in the hotel rooms. I ended up using a sweatshirt at night because I needed something flatter and fitting to my neck. This pillow saved my life traveling so I can actually sleep. I can easily push it into my bookbag or top of my suitcase. I loooove everything about this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Renee M. Canfield

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfy Pillow
customer_reviews.text: I was on a 3-day camping/white-water rafting trip and took this pillow along. It is the most comfortable pillow I could have taken with me. I sleep on my sides and this pillow took me off to dreamland fast after a long day. It has the perfect amount of give and support. On any future camping trips this pillow is the first thing I'll be packing. You won't be sorry you bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: DMW

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: After buying 20 different pillows and returning them, I found this pillow that is absolutely great. It has shredded foam inside so you can adjust the height of the pillow to your own needs. Is super comfortable and great quality. After using to sleep for 2 months I decided to buy another one to have it as a spare one.. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mypenname

customer_reviews.title: Nice carry bag, but...
customer_reviews.text: Needed a decent travel pillow. Love this, with some work, does fit in a carry case. It does take some strength to roll it up tight enough and helpful to have another person help with putting it in the carry bag. Always maintains is shape and fluffiness. Easy to remove cover for washing. Just as comfortable as their full size pillow. Customer service was just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pillow, a bit smaller
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love mine for camping. No more stiff neck! A little on the heavy side and a little bulky, as camp pillows go (especially inflatables), but so worth it. Great for in bed or on the sofa too, when you’re not on an outdoor adventure.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Super Awesome Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great product - extremely comfortable - now I can sleep in my tent / hammock !!! this is SO MUCH better than a blow up pillow - takes a little more space but sleeping now so it's worth it. Cheap storage bag though - it's coming apart already - and wish they had compression straps to further reduce the size. Still highly recommended. I purchased 2.
customer_reviews.author: Markluke

customer_reviews.title: Love this pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pillow in preparation for a trip to Europe. I typically travel with my own pillow a my neck cannot handle pillows that lack support, but I did not want to take my full size Tempurpedic to Europe. I started using this one a few months before my trip to test it out and haven't stopped. I LOVE this pillow!! My little travel size is more comfortable than my Tempurpedic. It can be easily re-fluffed and it is large enough o use on a daily basis, at about half the size of a standard size pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Quarneri

customer_reviews.title: Best pillow for all occasions of travel or not!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a European traveling trip. It fit lovely in its bag and into my carry on bag. I love the support and the feel. I even used it on the planes and the trains. It’s a lovely size, not too big yet it’s not so tiny you feel like a giant. I’ve washed it a few times on hot and cold, and air dryer in tumble dryer on air. Lovely. I’m going to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: ChristieM

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone with neck pain
customer_reviews.text: If you have neck pain, you need this. I bought this pillow for camping, after trying 3 other types of camp pillows and hating them all. I’ve had neck issues since a car accident years ago and normally sleep with a memory foam side sleeping pillow. I have never been so comfortable while camping with this little pillow! It’s so worth the extra space and weight!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Joy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable! Love!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a fantastic pillow. Well made and easy to clean! Very comfortable. Ordered for my dad, but I may purchase one in the future. Can use at home, between your legs awhile sleeping, at your recliner, or camping. Love it. I bought a 2 pack TILLYOU toddler pillowcases that fit perfect with this pillow and other small pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Spafford

customer_reviews.title: Love this travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow has saved me so many times over the past few months. It takes up a little more space than I wish it did in a suitcase, but it is SO worth it. As someone who is used to sleeping with two fluffy, supportive pillows at home, I knew I would miss a good pillow during the extensive travel I was doing this summer. (Europe seems to prefer flat pillows.) I used this pillow on flights and every night of my trips. Also love that it has a soft, washable cover.
customer_reviews.author: kmcquivey

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky but awesome for travel
customer_reviews.text: We just took a 2 week Australia and New Zealand trip, and I wanted travel pillows for my wife and daughters. They hate the neck pillows. These travel pillows, although a little bulky, are perfect for planes and cars. They used them a lot and slept really well. The pillows are soft and comfortable and the perfect size for travel.
customer_reviews.author: SD Family of 5

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Buy - Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PILLOW. High quality and very comfortable - a great size for camping. The stuff sack still makes the pillow about the size of a football, but it hangs nicely on the outside of the pack. We used it while car camping and while on the airplane... it’s very dense so it’s a great shape and style for window seats!
customer_reviews.author: ASGlaze

customer_reviews.title: Almost what I need
customer_reviews.text: I like a really firm pillow. Firm so that my head does not sink in to the point that it is on my eyes, nose, or mouth. i nearly always have to make my own pillow by opening one and adding all the fill from another to get the firmness I need. This one was way too soft to begin with, but I requested the extra fill and added it all and it is almost firm enough now.
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: So far it's 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and another pillow for an upcoming trip. This pillow is comfortable and seems to be made of very good quality products. I have not slept on the pillow yet but it seems like it's going to be very comfortable! The other pillow is going back and I ordered another one of these! Don't waste your time or money on other travel pillows. This one is great!
customer_reviews.author: MaisiB

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, comfortable pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is my second COOP pillow ... they are so well made, so comfortable and very adjustable. COOP has apparently improved their manufacturing process, since this latest pillow had very little odor out of the box, which was a bit of an issue with the previous one I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: mdw

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: First pillow I've gotten where I've had to remove stuffing because it was too thick. It's great that you can adjust it to your preference. It's a bit heavier than I'd wish (very heavy compared to a Thermarest camping pillow) but it's so comfortable that the weight is easily forgiven. I just wouldn't take it backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: James Lundeen

customer_reviews.title: and we both were extremely happy. We used these pillows on a 17 hour ...
customer_reviews.text: The pillow was so stuffed, I took some of the filling out and made 2 pillows from it. (It comes with 2 zippered cases). My sister had ordered a different brand travel pillow for the same price, which was too loosely and scantily filled. So, I let her use my "spare" I made, and we both were extremely happy. We used these pillows on a 17 hour plane ride, which is not fun, but at least these pillows made it bearable. I even used it in the places we slept that provided regular pillows because this was more comfortable. I suggest you look no further, and buy this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel companion
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pillow for a two month trip around Southeast Asia and I couldn't be happier with the product! Yes, it's a little heavier and bulkier than other travel pillows, but it isn't cumbersome, it packs right up into its stuff bag, and I just carabiner it on to the outside of my pack. BUT... it is seriously SO comfortable. I have used this on overnight busses and trains, in airports and in hostels. It is awesome... just do it. You will not regret the addition.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca diemer

customer_reviews.title: The Goldilocks of Camp Pillows
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed using this pillow on a recent Scout outing. I've used other camp pillows over the years, but never could get a comfortable night's rest with the standard fare. This pillow is large enough, but not so much as to be a packing burden. I would call it the Goldilocks of camping pillows. Recomended.
customer_reviews.author: RickF

customer_reviews.title: It does the job fine, but my main issue with this product is ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I travel a lot for work and would often have to bring my own pillow when staying at retreat centers. It does the job fine, but my main issue with this product is that it does not include a cover, and is too small for standard pillow covers. It is much smaller than I thought it was going to be. It's not uncomfortable, so I continue to use it, but I would have preferred it to come with a pillow cover and to be larger.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Makes travel so much better
customer_reviews.text: Hotel pillows are never comfortable, always too flat! After researching a bunch of travel foam pillows, decided to purchase this one and did not disappoint! It’s a little small, but works for me since I don’t toss and turn too much. Gives great support and makes sleeping away from home much more comfortable. Also like that it’s made in the USA and free of many of the chemicals used in other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: tin_can17

customer_reviews.title: No more sore travel neck from hotel pillows!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little pillow! I suffer from stiff necks whenever I travel because the pillows are always ridiculously soft and non-supportive... no more! This is definitely worth the room it takes in the suitcase. It rolls up into the sack nicely. I bought a toddler pillowcase for it which is perfect. I am very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is fantastic for camping. I love that it can be compacted down to a small size. The pillow is comfortable and comes with it's own pillow case and stuff sack. A great addition to my camping supplies and sure beats bringing a full size pillow as it doesn't take up much room at all!
customer_reviews.author: jj coutts

customer_reviews.title: Stuff sack problems
customer_reviews.text: The pillow was just what I needed for hammock camping recently. It was comfortable, light, and compressed easily. The stuff sack however is total junk; it started coming apart at the seam the first time I tried stuffing the pillow in...disappointing considering its for camping and travel.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, not sure why other reviewers are saying it doesn’t come with a pillow case or is too hard to roll up in to the compression sack, takes me about 45 seconds to roll two of these pillows back up into their sacks, it does have a pillow case, first layer is the pillow, second layer IS the case, my only issue was the smell but that is very common with memory foam.
customer_reviews.author: Treson

customer_reviews.title: Sweet dreams
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is the right size and consistency for me. It’s the perfect combination. Just what I was looking for. The only problem I’m having with it is a slight odor. I’ve sprayed it numerous times wirh febreze but it still has a smell. I’m hoping maybe in time it’ll disappear. I haven’t put it in the travel bag yet cause I’ve bern airing it out. It I don’t foresee a problem. It’ll b tight but I know it’ll fit.
customer_reviews.author: mrsdrshopper55

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to fit inside travel pouch
customer_reviews.text: The pillow arrives in a plastic bag with the travel pouch separate. It is nearly impossible and time consuming to fit the pillow inside the travel pouch. The scent of the foam is also quite strong. With that said, the pillow is better than not having a pillow while camping. very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: A little heavy for a camping pillow, but totally worth it for the comfort.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the lightest camping pillow out there, but I sleep like a baby when I use it instead of tossing and turning in my sleeping bag like I used to. So I guess that's the price you pay for comfort. I'm very pleased with it. And I haven't found it difficult to put in the stuff sack like some other folks have claimed.
customer_reviews.author: ZEROtwo

customer_reviews.title: Sleeps hot
customer_reviews.text: I should have known. I'd gotten rid or my memory foam mattress because it slept too hot for me. Hoped "shredded" memory foam might be different. It's not. The comfort and support were good. Just too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Ruckman

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Hesitate to Buy
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is well above what I expected.....it is soft...yet firm and comfortable..I bought this camping pillow for my trip to Australia and New Zealand, thought I'd break it in first at home (a recommended action) first night it was all over...gave up "My Pillow" for this one, even though smaller. Looking forward to my long flight in comfort.... (also gave it a name..."Patty" ) my new pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with purchase. It was actually too stuffed for me but was able to easily remove some stuffing which I used on a too flat travel pillow. I use 3 pillows which s a problem when sleeping in a sleeping bag. This pillow solved my problem. I use it between my knees. It is very firm and comfortable. It is easily rolled up and put back in travel bag and expands when removed from bag.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great camping pillow.
customer_reviews.text: Great little pillow. There is a smell when the pillow first arrives. Take the liner off and place it in the dryer a couple of times and the smell goes away. This is going to be a game changer for camping and overnights. As long as the temp is above ~50F the pillow is really easy to stuff back into its stuff bag.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I have many, many pillows as I suffer from severe shoulder pain. My daughter and son-in-law have the Coop pillows and love them. I decided to try the travel one, since I desperately needed one. Since its VERY fast arrival, I tried it out before I leaving on vacation. I'm still using it! I couldn't be happier with less shoulder pain and longer sleeping times. I highly recommend this pillow! I'll be purchasing a regular size Coop pillow when I return from my trip!
customer_reviews.author: ReadaLot

customer_reviews.title: great travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a recent trip to Cuba, where I wasn't sure what the pillows would be like. This was a great little pillow and served me well both in bed and on the plane. I never could get it to squeeze down back into the bag, but managed to use another bag I had which worked ok. Still better than those blow up pillows.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Rusinow

customer_reviews.title: The best camping/travel pillow on the market; great for side sleeping too!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing camping pillow. It’s thick enough to sleep on your side comfortably and not have a neck ache in the morning. It’s also really comfortable sleeping on your back. I’ve tried numerous travel pillow and this one is the best by far. It also very easily rolls up into a compact travel pack and then it quickly reshapes itself when unpacking. It’s truly the best camping or travel pillow on the market!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Culligan Vernon

customer_reviews.title: I got this to replace my LL Bean camping pillow since they changed their design which I didn't like. This little guy is so comfy
customer_reviews.text: I am very picky about pillows. I got this to replace my LL Bean camping pillow since they changed their design which I didn't like. This little guy is so comfy I now use it all the time. Soft yet supportive. A bit heavier than most camping pillows, so probably not for backpacking. I also take it on plane rides - perfect travel pillow. It rolls up compactly and fits into a pretty small bag. Great pillow.
customer_reviews.author: P. Cyr

customer_reviews.title: I find this pillow to be super comfortable. I first tried a very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I find this pillow to be super comfortable. I first tried a very good quality, highly rated inflatable pillow but could not get comfortable with it (noisy and slipped out from under my head). The only minor negative with this pillow is that it takes up a little more space in my bike packing bag but i have room enough for it just the same. also, i managed to lose the stuff sack that came with it so i called customer service - they were extremely friendly and efficient in getting me hooked up with a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Burgart

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the Coop Home Goods pillows - and I am VERY picky about my pillows. Think Princess and the Pea. I know, it's ridiculous. But horrible pillows make for a sore neck and back and a cranky me in the morning, so it is what it is. Love that they make their awesome, adjustable pillow in a small camping/travel size!
customer_reviews.author: makismom

customer_reviews.title: I removed some of the stuffing and the pillow is great. Also
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is very fluffy. I removed some of the stuffing and the pillow is great. Also, the pillow size is perfect for my trip. However, as the reviews indicated, the pillow does have a strange smell but I followed the instructions on how to get rid of the smell and the pillow is great now. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: greatgirls

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful travel pillow! I am deployed, and I've carried this with me through the long movement out, and through the deployment, and it is great! Very comfortable, and adjustable to your fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia C. Beltre

customer_reviews.title: Backpacking Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable pillow that I've ever taken backpacking. Downside is it takes up a lot of room, but if you can manage to secure to the outside without it swinging around you'll not regret this buy. I've had it with me on multiple several day backpacking trips this year and it's lights out when I call it a day. I've purchased a few other stuff sacks to try and compress more to save on room, but it doesn't compress great. Still, can't imagine a few nights on the trail without it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Love this pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I use it as my main pillow on my bed and it is plenty big enough. I had to take out some of the filling as it was too full. It is a wonderful pillow and I recommend buying this size if you are unsure about spending the money on the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley D. Socling

customer_reviews.title: Best travel pillow
customer_reviews.text: I think this is probably the 5th or 6th different travel pillow I've bought off Amazon. I've tried every style. Who would have thought that the best one was just a small memory foam pillow. Beats any neck wrap style and whatever else is out there.
customer_reviews.author: CWB1984

customer_reviews.title: Perfect while traveling back from Afghanistan and needed to take ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect while traveling back from Afghanistan and needed to take and use my own bedding for approximately 10 days. These were the perfect option for smaller size decent pillows. Love that they're washable
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find a travel pillow that is comfortable. Most are way too hard. This pillow is great. Being able to move the stuffing around to your comfort level is amazing. Then you can roll it up to a small size for travel. No more having my pillow take up so much of my suitcase. Highly recommend and the customer service is excellent. They will give you suggestions how to modify the shredded memory foam so you sleep well. I know some people comment on the smell. I put in the dryer on low with a softener sheet for 1 hour and the smell was completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great Arm Pillow for Side Sleepers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this pillow to try as a knee pillow since I'm a side sleeper. It worked as a knee pillow, but not as well as a regular knee pillow. I've ended up using the pillow to rest my top arm on and it works great for that purpose. I'm not sure how good it would be to use as a travel pillow as I think it would be too small, at least for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived early and is exactly as the add stated.
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is exactly what my body needed. Unfortunately I can not use it in my hammock, as I sleep on my back and that makes my head too high. I just don't use a pillow at all in my hammock. That being said, I use it at home and it is awesome. Plan on buying two big ones when I get my new bed.... Definitely would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: SheepDog

customer_reviews.title: Travel pillow worth taking
customer_reviews.text: This pillow rolls up and stuffs into a sack. Once it is opened it fluffs up to a very nice pillow.This works great for all kinds of places- AirBnb, hotels, camping, you name it. I even take it with me on car journeys . The pillow is even adjustable, you can remove some of the stuffing if you choose. GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Marie

customer_reviews.title: Undeniably best pillow. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable pillow out there! Compact. Light. Durable. I used this for a month and have never slept so good outdoors. Pillow doesn’t get hot, maintains shape, and you can mold it to whatever fits most comfortably for you, whether you are a side, back, or stomach sleeper. Done outdoors? Simply throw it in the wash. Loved this pillow so much I bought the bigger versions for my bed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Smithee

customer_reviews.title: I can finally sleep well away from home
customer_reviews.text: I am a stomach/side/light sleeper who needs a low-profile and supportive pillow. I love to travel, but hotel pillows are usually too fluffy for me. I tested this pillow last night and while it's smaller than a standard pillow, it's supportive and comfortable. I got a great night's sleep and have crossed one big thing off my worry list for my upcoming, week-long stay overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Robbins

customer_reviews.title: No more hotel pillow hell
customer_reviews.text: Hotel pillows are always overly full and firm or overly soft and awful. After terrible sleep over 4 years of work travel I finally sleep well with this pillow. I love that it's adjustable and I actually have a ziplock bag of fill that I removed that I'll use when I need it. The travel sack is plenty big to fit the pillow and fits well in luggage. Totally worth the money if you travel/camp at all. My one request is that they make a pillow case for it but the outer cover is removable for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Vonhof

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for my bed. No dangling feet!
customer_reviews.text: As a taller guy this is fantastic not just for camping or travel. With a normal size pillow my feet hanging off the end of my bed. This smaller pillow allows me to scoot up further on the bed and viola, no hanging feet! It is also just straight up comfortable. Plus, as a chronic tumbler, the pillow is light enough for me to take it with me wherever I roll around to.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Feels pretty amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for camping at a festival. Honestly, I could have brought a full sized pillow as well, but this did the job just fine and actually feels better than the pillows I use at home. I'm likely going to be buying a couple regular sized variants of this pillow because of my camping experience with this. I would definitely recommend this pillow to anyone who is on the fence about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mista

customer_reviews.title: Smell doesn’t go away
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is very comfortable, but two things I must provide to buyers: 1) this is more my fault, but I expected it to compress more - when putting it in my hiking pack (65 liters) it took up a lot of space and 2) when you get it, it cones with instructions on how to get rid of the smell it has from being vacuum packed - this did not work - I tried everything and put it in the dryer for roughly 20 hours (they say it will come out in 1.5 hours) and it still didn’t work. It’s still a good pillow just hard to get over the smell at least for me.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Clapper

customer_reviews.title: Great travel pillow.
customer_reviews.text: Hotel pillows flatten to nothing. I’m never leaving home without this pillow. Wife uses in the car and airplanes and I use it when she’s not with me! A little on the heavy side for hiking camping so I bought a lighter one. But for travel you can’t beat this one! Might have to get a second.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: but soooo comfortable. I had a really hard time carrying it ...
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is not a travel pillow by any means. It is bulky and big, but soooo comfortable. I had a really hard time carrying it around on my hiking trip, so just be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Softness Lacking Support
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love how the pillow can be so compact. It's also so soft! That softness comes at a cost though. It has little support. When sleeping with this pillow, I try to sleep on my back instead of my side. Sleeping on my side with this pillow makes me wake up with a sore arm. Granted, I've been sleeping on this for two weeks straight.
customer_reviews.author: Lafar

customer_reviews.title: What is this, a pillow for ants!?
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is TINY. I don't think the pictures do it justice on just how small it is. The pillow isn't high enough to get the benefits of it being made from memory foam. This might have been okay if it was priced at $10-15 but at $30, this is just plain insulting.
customer_reviews.author: H Kim
